definition: to invite job applications/to recruit
4th note in pentatonic scale 五音[wu3 yin1], roughly sol/see also 徵|征[zheng1]
to invite/to recruit/to levy (taxes)/to draft (troops)/phenomenon/symptom/characteristic sign (used as proof)/evidence
to engage (a teacher etc)/to hire/to betroth/betrothal gift/to get married (of woman)

sentences.english: The school advertised for teachers in the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 學校在報紙上登廣告徵聘教師。

sentences.english: All personal data collected will be used strictly for recruitment purpose.
sentences.chinese: 一切個人資料只作徵聘用途。

sentences.english: List only those skills related to the job you are applying for.
sentences.chinese: 只列出那些與你正在徵聘的工作有關的技能。

sentences.english: We are looking for qualified lecturers to join our pool of passionate teaching faculty.
sentences.chinese: 我們正在徵聘資質的幼教培訓講師。

sentences.english: I have go through thousands of these want ads.
sentences.chinese: 我仔細看過成千上萬條這種徵聘廣告了。

definition: expert in a specialized field such as medicine, divination or chess, available on call to the emperor (in the Tang and Song dynasties)
imperial envoy
to act as regent
Emperor Ningzong of Southern Song (1168-1224)
to engage (a teacher etc)/to hire/to betroth/betrothal gift/to get married (of woman)
Zanhuang county in Shijiazhuang 石家莊|石家庄[Shi2 jia1 zhuang1], Hebei
(history) a hunting party
Wei of the Northern Dynasties 386-534
Grand Servant in imperial China, one of the Nine Ministers 九卿[jiu3 qing1]
Later Han or Eastern Han dynasty (25-220)/Later Han of the Five Dynasties (947-950)
surname Yuchi
Anguo county level city in Baoding 保定[Bao3 ding4], Hebei
Longxi county in Dingxi 定西[Ding4 xi1], Gansu
Director of Board of Rites (Confucian)
Jixian county in Shuangyashan 雙鴨山|双鸭山[Shuang1 ya1 shan1], Heilongjiang
(old) candidate who has successfully passed the first grades of the examination system, but not yet the court examination (殿試|殿试[dian4 shi4])
